instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1707 BIN Needs ME Cleared
threads.message:
I have an 820-00928 that had a short in the PCH, PP3v3_SUS was shorted, once I replaced the PCH the short was gone and the system turned on. 

Just need the ME region cleared now. 

Here is the BIN:

[url]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1M0BTHtQI9epDfCvHfFAa8qnJoc4KXs3T/view?usp=sharing[/url]

Please can someone clear it?

threads.title: A1707 BIN Needs ME Cleared
threads.message: With your file, the system turns on, fans spin but nothing else. With your file, the CPU/GPU/PCH stays cold. With my original file, all those turn on.

threads.title: A1707 BIN Needs ME Cleared
threads.message: Let me know when you have time. Thank you!

threads.title: A1707 BIN Needs ME Cleared
threads.message: Hi, can you retry and clean my original bin and send it to me?

threads.title: A1707 BIN Needs ME Cleared
threads.message:
Did you try original backup again and machine boots?
I will try again tomorrow with Medusa...

threads.title: A1707 BIN Needs ME Cleared
threads.message: Yes, I installed my original and the machine turns on, shows an image, will boot to user-id & password screen but is slow and I cannot complete booting into the desktop. After having no power, short on PP3V3_SUS, replacing U1100, the short removed after replacing U1100, then getting the machine to power on and boot, at this point I'm sure I just need a good clean ME. I appreciate you. I have ordered a Medusa, but problems in the mail right now :(. So I try again here. Thank you.

threads.title: A1707 BIN Needs ME Cleared
threads.message:
Thank you [B][USER=682]2informaticos[/USER]![/B]

It worked! This Mac is a happy Mac again! Can you please make the above files unavailable, that way the serial #'s do not get duplicated out there. Thanks!
